methodology: Automated scorer (src/scorer.rs) — zero LLM involvement. 11 check types: AST parsing, pytest execution, grep patterns, file existence, test counting.

tickets.task: Security audit: fix all validation gaps

freestyle_hard_results.note: BENCH-7 scorer bug fixed 2026-02-25: grep pattern required 'decremented_items' but implementations use 'decremented'. All 5 variance runs actually implement rollback correctly and score 100/100 with corrected pattern.

bench6.finding: Quality perfectly consistent (0 std dev). Cost varies 6x across identical runs.

bench7.finding: All runs implement rollback correctly. Original scorer pattern was too strict (required 'decremented_items', accepted 'decremented' after fix).

anvil_lite_bench6.note: Same quality as freestyle. Governance phases add $2.25 overhead. Verification caught residual mutation and forced retry.

key_findings: BENCH-6 quality: 90/100 on all 7 runs (0 std dev) — residual last_adjusted mutation persists every run
BENCH-6 cost: $0.24-$1.45 across runs (6x range) — cost unpredictability is the risk, not quality variance
BENCH-9: 90/100 — freestyle fixes validation gaps but leaves BUG comments in source files
Anvil lite: 90/100 on BENCH-6 with $2.25 governance overhead — same quality, auditable process
Scorer discriminates: unfixed baselines 39-48%, both approaches improve to 90-100%
